title: Fault tolerance in RestClient issues
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm trying to apply the fault tolerance annotations directly on a rest client interface. It doesn't seem to work.

### Expected behavior

I would expect to be able to use the fault tolerance annotations directly on a rest client interface.

### Actual behavior

The application doesn't even compile. I get this when I try to do `./mvnw clean package`:

```
[ERROR] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 2, Time elapsed: 2.178 s <<< FAILURE! -- in com.example.RestClientTestTests

```

Running the application in dev mode doesn't work either with similar errors.

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: https://github.com/edeandrea/rest-client-ft-test

Clone the reproducer and run `./mvnw clean package`. You will see the error. It seems to have to do with the `@CircuitBreakerName` annotation. It does not like it on the interface.

If I remove it then things seem to function ok, but then my tests fail because they are looking for it.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

```
Darwin edeandrea-m1pro 22.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.6.0: Wed Jul  5 22:22:05 PDT 2023; root:xnu-8796.141.3~6/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64
```

### Output of `java -version`

```
openjdk version "17.0.8" 2023-07-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.8+7 (build 17.0.8+7)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.8+7 (build 17.0.8+7, mixed mode)
```

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

`3.4.1`

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

```
Apache Maven 3.9.3 (21122926829f1ead511c958d89bd2f672198ae9f)

Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "13.5.2", arch: "aarch64", family: "mac"
```

### Additional information

_No response_
